page.title: 03SALT MARSHES
page.content: While at Bere Ferrers investigating things for our Domesday project,we visited the Salt Marshes at Thorn Point.We knew this area would be unlike any other. By the Salt Marshes there were a great many things to discover.We found three rabbit holes in a bank.Also,upon the marshes,there were a lot of dead crabs.We think that they were dropped by seagulls.The gulls eat the inside part and then drop the inedible shell. Growing by the salt marshes were some very rare Black Cherry trees.Bere Ferrers is famous for these special trees.They provide a rare fruit and a very pretty blossom. The water in the marshes has a high salt content.We did an experiment at school to show this by comparing it with river water.
